definition: cat/CL:隻|只[zhi1]/(dialect) to hide oneself/(coll.) modem

sentences.english: There is something fishy behind this.
I think there must be something very shady about this contract.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得這張合同裏面一定有什麼貓膩兒。

sentences.english: He is selling this cellphone for only 100 yuan, there must be some catch .
sentences.chinese: 他這個手機只賣100元，這其中肯定有貓膩兒。

sentences.english: I think there was some hanky -panky with the last election.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得最後一次的選舉中有貓膩。

sentences.english: This makes it substantially more obvious to the user that there may be an issue.
sentences.chinese: 這樣能夠更顯著的讓用戶瞭解這裏可能有貓膩。

sentences.english: Ah, you're thinking, there's a trick to this.
sentences.chinese: 呃，你開始想，這裏一定有貓膩。

sentences.english: We look at a few common scenarios and help you sift through the rubble.
sentences.chinese: 我們來看一些常見的情景，幫你看清楚其中的貓膩。

sentences.english: Shenzhen investigates rigorously the fees trick of telecommunication postal service.
sentences.chinese: 深圳嚴查電信郵政資費貓膩。

definition: to have no sense of shame/brazen
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
a hidden trouble hard to mention (idiom)/sth too embarrassing to mention/an embarrassing illness
lit. cannot rest or eat in peace (idiom)/fig. extremely worried and troubled
to know the score (idiom)/to be well aware of the situation
lit. not even the chickens and dogs are left undisturbed (idiom)/fig. great commotion/pandemonium
to go dining, wining, whoring and gambling/to lead a life of dissipation
to ignore/to brush off/to dismiss/to pay no attention to
